image.altText: A large silver truck drives off into a pink sunset.

props.synopsis: Australia's road transport industry is facing a growing driver shortage driven by an aging workforce and limited recruitment of younger people.

title.children: Truck driver shortage puts squeeze on Australia's supply chain

image.altText: An elevated shot of tightly packed black-roofed houses stretching into the distance.

props.synopsis: The red-hot Australian housing market is showing the first signs of easing since interest rates started rising in May 2022.

title.children: Australian property market hits first snag in years

image.altText: Four men start paddling on a boat made of cans in water at the beach

props.synopsis: From pint-sized penny farthings to tuna tosses, a beer can regatta to the Running of the Sheep, there's a regional festival for everyone's interests.

title.children: Add these must-do regional festivals to your 2026 calendar

image.altText: Graffitied roller doors on Victoria Street.

props.synopsis: Richmond's Victoria Street, once a buzzing area home to dozens of restaurants and grocers, has seen better days. What can be done to bring it back to its bustling best?

title.children: Vacancies, drugs and graffiti dim iconic Melbourne strip — until now

image.altText: A police mug shot of a woman.

props.synopsis: Jean Lee and her two co-accused were executed for murder in 1950. Handwritten letters from the trio are among items publicly available for the first time since their trial captured the nation's attention.

title.children: Case file of last woman hanged in Australia released after 75 years

image.altText: A police crime scene.

props.synopsis: Two men were taken to hospital with serious injuries after being stabbed in Carlton shortly before midnight.

title.children: Police investigate Melbourne NYE double stabbing

image.altText: Fireworks over city buildings.

props.synopsis: Police make 18 arrests and several people are taken to hospital for injuries related to illegal fireworks as Victorians see in the new year.

title.children: Police happy with Melbourne revellers despite arrests and fireworks injuries

image.altText: Nine police surround one man (face not shown) as two of them put him in the back of a divvy van in a residential street.

props.synopsis: Police charge a man after a two-day pursuit that resulted in a police officer being injured and multiple police vehicles being rammed.

title.children: Man, 34, charged with 66 offences after police hunt in Latrobe Valley

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: A man and a woman will face court charged with numerous offences, including manufacturing unauthorised explosive devices.

title.children: Police find explosives, arrest two people in Bendigo suburb

image.altText: A man in a polo shirt in an old building standing beside a morse code machine

props.synopsis: Even as digital technology continues to evolve, "Morsecodians" aim to preserve a once-essential way to communicate across the world.

title.children: Morse code lovers and navy trainers persist with skill others deem a dying art

image.altText: Beth in a hard hat covered in soot

props.synopsis: TV presenter and former builder Barry Du Bois is lobbying Canberra for change.

title.children: First apprenticeship 'hell' for tradie who wants hazing to stop

image.altText: A photo of John Cain.

props.synopsis: Previously secret cabinet documents from the Labor governments of John Cain Jr and Joan Kirner have been released to the public for the first time.

title.children: Cabinet documents from one of Victoria's most influential governments released

image.altText: Nick McKenzie wearing a blue suit and tie

props.synopsis: Investigators from a taskforce targeting crime in the construction industry say a 31-year-old man threatened journalist Nick McKenzie in a Christmas Eve call.

title.children: Man charged with making threatening phone call to Melbourne journalist

image.altText: Richard Jeffares wears a polo jumper and stands in a brewery, smiling, next to a bag of gluten free grain.

props.synopsis: Brewer Richard Jeffares's Victorian company raised about $2.5 million from 993 investors in a matter of days through a method called crowd-sourced funding, also known as equity crowdfunding.

title.children: Would you invest in your favourite craft beer? Nearly 1,000 people have

image.altText: One of the main entrances to Crown Casino in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: About 500 workers at Melbourne's Crown casino will stop work on Wednesday after rejecting a proposal they say will cut pay for new workers and imperil those currently employed.

title.children: Crown casino workers announce New Year's Eve strike amid wage row

image.altText: A smiling Stella Thurbon standing near a lake with goats.

props.synopsis: With bells tinkling, tails flicking, and panniers packed to the brim, adventurer Stella Thurbon has spent 26 days winding through the Victorian High Country with nine goats trotting faithfully behind her.

title.children: Stella leads 'goat squad' on hike through Victoria's High Country

image.altText: A woman in red thigh-high boots and catsuit reclines in a red wingback chair in an overgrown unused lot.

props.synopsis: The exhibition at Melbourne's newest museum, featuring Kylie Minogue's catsuit and Elton John's Louis XIV-inspired 50th birthday outfit, celebrates the power of divas through time.

title.children: Kylie's red Padam Padam outfit stars in DIVA exhibit

image.altText: A man running.

props.synopsis: Police are looking for a man who allegedly tried to steal a woman's car in Richmond earlier this year but was foiled by bystanders, including one person wielding a golf club.

title.children: Bystanders fight off alleged Melbourne carjacker

image.altText: A man sitting in front of a poker machine. Two more poker machines are next to him.

props.synopsis: A researcher says data on gambling-related suicides underestimates the crisis "devastating people and families".

title.children: 'I didn't even know they gambled': An 'invisible' factor in suicide

image.altText: Woodside's offshore North Rankin gas platform at sunset.

props.synopsis: Documents reveal one of Australia's biggest oil and gas companies knowingly shed plastic into the ocean for two months before notifying the offshore regulator.

title.children: Oil and gas giant knowingly sheds plastic into the ocean

image.altText: Josh Burns stands in a corridor at Parliament House

props.synopsis: In a broad-ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, the rising Labor star reveals he plans to take extended leave to care for his baby daughter.

title.children: Josh Burns to take rare extended parental leave from parliament next year

image.altText: Victoria Police

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old carrying a hunting knife was among more than 100 arrests during the first few weeks of a police operation at four of Melbourne's biggest shopping centres.

title.children: Police make 100 arrests during first weeks of Melbourne shopping centre operations

image.altText: A curator talks to an official as they look at the pitch during a break in a cricket Test at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The ICC has handed down their verdict on the controversial MCG pitch which led to this year's Boxing Day Test wrapping up after just two days.

title.children: ICC hands down punishment for 'unsatisfactory' MCG pitch

image.altText: Victoria ambulance outside the Melbourne Juvenile Justice Centre

props.synopsis: Ambulance Victoria says paramedics were assaulted, spat on and sexually harassed in a series of serious incidents over the festive period.

title.children: 'Enough is enough': Ambos describe confronting rise in assaults over Christmas

image.altText: Emma Johnston smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: University of Melbourne vice-chancellor Emma Johnston has died from complications associated with cancer, aged 52.

title.children: Family, colleagues in 'disbelief' after leading scientist dies aged 52

image.altText: A boarded up shop front. There is an open sign on the outside.

props.synopsis: A tobacco shop is rammed with a vehicle weeks after receiving a shakedown note demanding the owner "contact the commission".

title.children: Tobacco shop rammed in failed firebomb attempt

image.altText: A police car near a burnt out boat

props.synopsis: Emergency services were on Monday called to a Lake Eildon boat ramp where two men had sustained serious injuries in a fire.

title.children: Two men flown to hospital after Bonnie Doon boat fire

image.altText: A house-sized bluestone castle sits in a residential street; fit with a drawbridge and flying flag.

props.synopsis: They say "a man's home is his castle" but one builder from south-west Victoria has taken that literally when creating a dream home for his son.

title.children: 'A dream come true': Father builds castle with moat and dungeon for son

image.altText: Katie Pahlow catches a wave while surfing in Lombok, Indonesia

props.synopsis: When Katie Pahlow turned 60, she decided to finally bite the bullet and book herself in for some surf lessons.

title.children: Why a growing number of older women are living out their surf dream

image.altText: Cassie Hlava sits on the boot of her ute.

props.synopsis: In a tiny town near the Victoria–South Australia border, a proposed wind farm near a protected wetland is posing a big question for Australia's planning regulators.

title.children: When green energy threatens what it is meant to save

image.altText: Climber Sarah Larcombe hanging by her arms off a rock wall. The Australian outback is in the background.

props.synopsis: When Sarah Larcombe fell off Mount Arapiles in February, she thought she just sprained her ankle. What followed was months of ups and downs ending in a stunning world championships result.

title.children: After Sarah Larcombe fell off Arapiles, healing her bones was just the beginning

image.altText: A seal with its mouth open.

props.synopsis: A wild seal dubbed "Grumpy" causes some commotion at an annual boat race on the Mornington Peninsula, outside Melbourne.

title.children: 'Grumpy' seal disrupts summer boat race at popular holiday spot

image.altText: driver lifting two fingers from a car steering wheel

props.synopsis: For generations, the courtesy wave has been etched into the Australian culture, but is it on the verge of dying?

title.children: Courtesy wave dying out, say truckies, but still alive on back roads

image.altText: Black and white grainy footage shows a car stopped on a road with police approaching.

props.synopsis: An overnight police chase across multiple suburbs has ended with the arrest of three teenagers after an alleged aggravated carjacking in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Teenagers charged after alleged aggravated carjacking in Melbourne

image.altText: A child with blonde hair and blue eyes wearing a pink long sleeved top, standing in a living room in front of a red couch.

props.synopsis: A woman is calling for tougher pool fencing regulations after her daughter crawled through a faulty fence and drowned in a neighbour’s pool.

title.children: Mum of four-year-old who drowned pleads for safer pool fences
